themes.title: Crawl-to-click gap
bullets: Cloudflare analysis highlights large disparities between pages crawled by AI platforms and the clicks/referrals those crawls generate.
High crawl-to-click ratios mean sites bear bandwidth and indexing costs without proportional traffic or attribution.
This gap may push publishers to adjust robots.txt, rate-limiting, or negotiate licensing and referral attribution with platforms.
quotes: Check out the 'Crawl to refer' ratios below
themes.commentary: The thread frames the crawl-versus-referral problem as a growing operational and attribution issue for publishers reliant on referral traffic.

themes.title: Anthropic remains crawl-heavy
bullets: Anthropic was identified as the most crawl-heavy platform in the dataset, continuing to fetch large numbers of pages despite recent reductions.
Even after an 87% year-over-year decline reported in the post, Anthropic still crawled 38,000 pages for the linked site, indicating sustained activity.
Persistently high crawl volumes from a single provider can strain servers and complicate traffic attribution and content licensing.
quotes: Anthropic remains the most crawl-heavy platform.
themes.commentary: The specific Anthropic figures give concrete scale to the problem, suggesting that platform-level behavior changes may lag perceived reductions in activity.

themes.title: Cloudflare bot and referral data
bullets: Cloudflare's telemetry is being used to measure how AI bots crawl, how much data they collect for training, and how often they refer users back to sources.
Platform-level differences in crawling and referral behavior are visible, which can guide site operators' mitigation and reporting strategies.
Armed with this data, web admins can prioritize defenses, request provenance, or demand referral credit from platforms.
quotes: Cloudflare data on AI bots, training, and referrals
themes.commentary: Observers view Cloudflare's dataset as a valuable empirical basis for operational decisions and policy discussions around AI training and fair referrals.
